page.title: 17SOUTH SHIELDS TYNE PILOT RTD
page.content:
I was apprentices in the pilot service in 1928. My duty was to put the pilots on board ships from an open rowing boat. It could be very dangferous at times, especially when the sea was rough and the ship was rolling.
Until recently, Shields' Pilots have nearly always lived close to the river's mouth, on the{Lawe Top},from the time of Richard the Lionheart. They also claim Viking ancestry.
I became a pilot in 1946 and was 30 years a TYne Pilot until I retired in 1976, my 66th birthday.
The river is not nearly so busy now as when I was piloting, but we live on an island and will always require ships.
